desc: TCF7L2 (Transcription factor 7-like 2) encodes a protein which acts as a positive transcriptional regulator of WNT/beta-catenin pathway response, a global regulator of embryonic development. A single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) within this gene, rs7903146, is the most significant genetic marker associated with Type 2 diabetes risk (PMID: 22872755) and gestational diabetes (PMID: 23690305). TCF7L2 is thought to act as a tumor suppressor by suppressing cell growth-promoting genes (PMID: 18621708). Its frameshift mutation has been implicated in colorectal cancer (PMID 18398040, 18478343). Variants of the gene are most likely involved in many other cancer types (PMID 18621708).
